EmailTemplate.subject: Would you like to be a Youth Assessor for NCS with The Challenge?
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Contact.FirstName}
YOU CAN DECIDE WHO WORKS FOR NCS WITH THE CHALLENGE!
Ever fancied being Alan Sugar in The Apprentice? This is your chance! Come and help us to assess staff for summer 2014
Location :- The Challenge Network office in Birmingham (The Custard Factory, Gibb Street, Digbeth, B9 4AA)
Length of the role :- Ideally 2 hours every week (but you can choose your dates)
Dates :- Jan - May 2014
Youth assessors will:-
- Observe candidates at mentor and leader assessments and grade their performance in group activities to assess their suitability to work on NCS with The Challenge
- Work alongside other Youth Assessors and Challenge staff to select successful candidates
Why should you do it?
- Snacks are provided and travel expenses are covered
- It will be a fun and interesting experience with other graduates
- You will be in charge of planning and leading one of the activities with other Youth Assessors
- It looks great on your CV - get first-hand experience of how assessments and interviews really work
- It counts towards ‘Challenge with Distinction’ awards
- You will have a real impact on our 2014 summer programme
Work dates
Assessments happen 1-2 times a week from Monday to Saturday between January and May. You will be required from 5:15pm to 7:15pm at a Monday-Friday assessment and from 3:15pm to 5:15pm on a Saturday. You do not have to work at every assessment - one day a week, or one day every two weeks, is fine.
If you would like more information please text ‘Youth Assessor’ to 07508 359 258
